alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:38AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sebastian, southeastern Sequoyah and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 638 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Spiro, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Pocola... Spiro... Arkoma... Hackett... Bonanza... Bokoshe... Moffett... Excelsior... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Jenny Lind... Cowlington... Scullyville... Braden... Mill Creek... Rye Hill... Jenson... Cottonwood... This includes Interstate 540 between mile markers 5 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
